alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 6:43AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bureau, northeastern Henry and northeastern Putnam Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 643 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Annawan, or 14 miles north of Kewanee, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sheffield around 650 AM CDT. Buda around 655 AM CDT. Wyanet around 700 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Princeton, Hennepin, DePue, Spring Valley, Ladd and Dalzell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 27 and 72. Interstate 180 between mile markers 7 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
